alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Cochran; Lamb; Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 12:26PM CDT until June 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and the Panhandle of Texas, including the following counties, in northwest Texas, Bailey, Cochran and Lamb. In the Panhandle of Texas, Parmer. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1223 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of strong to severe thunderstorms moving east producing very heavy rain. The line was moving into Bovina and Muleshoe. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Muleshoe, Friona, Bovina, Farwell, Needmore, Progress, Oklahoma Lane, Lariat, West Camp, Lazbuddie, Muleshoe Wildlife Refuge, Rhea, Black, Bula, Enochs and Maple. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
